item.title: Bulging and broken retaining wall, 20th January
item.description:
Photo taken from bus window on 20.1.25 while waiting at the temporary traffic lights going towards Bishop's Cleeve. The retaining wall on the racecourse side of the A435 road has broken mortar and is bulging in several places.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No cats eyes or lighting, 20th January
item.description:
On the A38 between Coombe Hill and Twigworth there are no cats eyes at all, and no street lights. In the fog last week vehicles ended up on the wrong side of the road as there was nothing to mark the edges or centre line.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Norton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 big and deep pot holes on A40, 20th January
item.description:
2 deep potholes on a40 east bound on the dual carriageway Oxford direction GL54 4BY. I can’t get a picture of the potholes as it’s on a bend on a busy road. It has buckled my front right alloy wheel

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Shipton, Cotswold

item.title: Another bin overflowing, 20th January
item.description:

item.title: Lack of / faded double yellow lines on Croft Road, 20th January
item.description:
The portion of Croft Road between number 27 and the entrance to Gilbert Ward Court is too narrow for vehicles to be parked on both sides of the road. The consensus has always been that vehicles park on the south side of the road here. However, some vehicles occasionally get parked on the north side, which either dangerously blocks the road or the footpath. Double yellow lines would prevent this. Furthermore, the double yellow lines leading into Gilbert Ward Court are faded and vehicles are often parked blocking the dropped curb.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croft Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
